ACC201.name: Principles of Financial Accounting
ACC201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC201.description: Purpose and content of corporate financial statements with emphasis on interpretation and understanding the effects of various transactions on these statements. Basic principles, conventions and concepts related to financial statements. Measurement of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses. International accounting concepts.
ACC201.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Business - Admitted major and open to sophomores or juniors or seniors in the Hospitality Business Major.

ACC202.name: Principles of Management Accounting
ACC202.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC202.description: Management uses of accounting information. Costing products and services, planning and budgeting, performance measurement, control of organizational activities, and decision making.
ACC202.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Business - Admitted major.

ACC230.name: Survey of Accounting Concepts
ACC230.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC230.description: Basic concepts in financial and managerial accounting for non-business majors.
ACC230.restrictions: Not open to students in the Accounting major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Business-Preference major or in the Finance Major or in the Hospitality Business Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major.

ACC250.name: Preparing for an Accounting Career
ACC250.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC250.description: Changing environment and career management in professional accounting. Change management, ethics, professional certification, improving writing and speaking skills, globalization, and technology.
ACC250.restrictions: Open to freshmen or sophomores and open to juniors in the Department of Accounting and Information Systems or approval of department.

ACC293.name: Cooperative Education for Business Students
ACC293.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC293.description: Integration of pre-professional educational employment experiences in industry and government with knowledge and processes taught in the student's academic program. Educational employment assignment approved by the Department of Supply Chain Management.

ACC300.name: Intermediate Financial Accounting I
ACC300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC300.description: U.S. and international concepts and procedures for preparing financial statements. Revenue recognition. Accounting for receivables, inventory, plant assets, intangibles and current liabilities. Applied research methods.
ACC300.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Accounting and Information Systems or in the Department of Finance or in the Business - Admitted major or approval of department.

ACC301.name: Intermediate Financial Accounting II
ACC301.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC301.description: U.S. and international concepts and procedures in accounting for various financial statement elements. Accounting for investments, bonds, leases, pensions, taxes, owners’ equity, earnings per share and comprehensive income.
ACC301.prerequisite: (ACC 300 or ACC 305) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ACC305.name: Intermediate Accounting for Finance Majors
ACC305.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC305.description: Major measurement, valuation, and reporting concepts and procedures underlying the assets, liabilities, owners' equity, revenues, and expenses contained in financial statements. Analysis, interpretation, and use of financial statements.
ACC305.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Finance Major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Business - Admitted major.

ACC308.name: Governmental and Not-for-Profit Accounting
ACC308.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC308.description: Financial reporting, budgeting and auditing issues in not-for-profit entities. Government-wide and fund financial statements for state and local governments, generally accepted accounting principles for not-for-profit entities, generally accepted government auditing standards, and budgeting.

ACC321.name: Accounting Information Systems
ACC321.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC321.description: Conceptual modeling and implementation of accounting transaction processing systems. Enterprise value chains, documentation of workflow processing and control requirements, and modeling of accounting interoperability requirements.

ACC331.name: Federal Income Tax Accounting
ACC331.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC331.description: Federal income taxation of businesses and individuals. Gross income, deductions, and tax computations for corporations and individuals.
ACC331.prerequisite: (ACC 300 or ACC 305) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ACC333.name: Taxation and Accounting for the Entrepreneur
ACC333.description: Basic concepts of income taxation and accounting applicable to business entrepreneurs and their business enterprises.
ACC333.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to students in the Department of Accounting and Information Systems.

ACC341.name: Accounting for Management Decision Making
ACC341.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC341.description: Identification of relevant accounting information for management decision making, planning and control. Evaluation of cost accounting system design choices for decision usefulness and effectiveness of performance measurement.
ACC341.prerequisite: (ACC 300 or ACC 305) and (STT 200 or STT 201 or STT 315)

ACC393.name: Introduction to International Business
ACC393.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC393.description: Introduction to the context of international business delivered on-site in foreign settings. Fundamental concepts and principles of globalization such as multinational corporations, foreign markets and economies, internal and external market transactions, international law, cultural influences, and multinational business strategies.
ACC393.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the School of Hospitality Business.

ACC411.name: Auditing
ACC411.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC411.description: The audit process and the role of financial statement audits in organizations and financial markets. Development of the attitude, knowledge, and skills required to meet ethical and auditing standards. Plan and perform audits. Communicate audit results.
ACC411.prerequisite: (ACC 300 or ACC 305) and ACC 321 and (STT 200 or STT 201 or STT 315)
ACC411.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Finance Major or in the Accounting major and open to master's students in the Accounting Major.

ACC490.name: Independent Study
ACC490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC490.description: Independent study in special topics in accounting under faculty supervision.

ACC491.name: Special Topics in Accounting and Information Systems
ACC491.description: Current and emerging issues in accounting and information systems.
ACC491.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Accounting and Information Systems or in the Department of Finance.

ACC493.name: Internship
ACC493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC493.description: Professional internship in public, industrial, or governmental accounting under faculty supervision.

ACC802.name: Financial Analysis I
ACC802.description: Concepts of financial analysis using U.S. and international accounting information. Supply of and demand for accounting information in financial markets.
ACC802.restrictions: Open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC803.name: Financial Analysis II
ACC803.description: Cash flow and earnings based accounting models for business valuation.
ACC803.restrictions: Open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC807.name: Financial Statement Analysis
ACC807.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC807.description: Concepts of financial analysis using U.S. and international accounting information. Cash-flow and earnings based models for business valuation, and supply of and demand for accounting information in financial markets.
ACC807.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC808.name: Contemporary Financial Reporting Decisions
ACC808.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC808.description: Framework for making professional judgments and decisions about accounting for contemporary financial reporting issues. Conceptual framework, standard setting, accounting for financial instruments, foreign subsidiaries, and hedging.
ACC808.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ACC814.name: Advanced Auditing
ACC814.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC814.description: Economic, regulatory and technology environments as it relates to auditing in the public and private sectors. Risk analysis, professional standards, audit evidence gathering and evaluations, accounting and auditing research and decision making.
ACC814.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ACC821.name: Enterprise Database Systems
ACC821.description: Management of information in business organizations. Conceptual modeling of transaction process systems, workflow systems and enterprise-wide networks of value-added activities. Integration of decision support and policy level systems with economic event processing systems. Evolution of accounting systems.
ACC821.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ACC822.name: Information Systems Project Management
ACC822.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC822.description: Management of information system projects. Modeling of business processes. Management of project scope, time and costs. Planning and control of projects. Program and portfolio management. Consulting issues for effective project management.
ACC822.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC823.name: Advanced Enterprise Database Systems
ACC823.description: Architecture of enterprise information. Semantic and syntactic modeling of enterprise economic phenomena, relational database technology and database design for business systems, business process analysis patterns and implementation compromises.
ACC823.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ACC824.name: Governance and Control of Enterprise Systems
ACC824.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC824.description: Governance and control of information technologies. Identification and valuation of key information and communication technologies, frameworks for assessing information system risk, information system auditing, and international standards for information technology governance and control.
ACC824.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or approval of department.

ACC825.name: Object-Oriented Business Information Systems
ACC825.description: Analysis and design of object-oriented business systems. Unified modeling language descriptions of business phenomena and rules, object-oriented programming, use-case analysis and specifications, and XML tag sets for transactions and reporting.
ACC825.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ACC826.name: Enterprise Information Systems
ACC826.description: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems. ERP implementation issues and success factors. Use of enterprise systems, and exploring future directions in ERP systems.
ACC826.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration or approval of department.

ACC827.name: Accounting Analytics
ACC827.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC827.description: Develop an accounting analytics mindset. Determine and apply appropriate data analytic techniques based upon the accounting environment and situation. Use data visualization, predictive analytics and other analytics software as appropriate.
ACC827.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting Major.

ACC830.name: Tax Research
ACC830.description: Writing and presentation techniques of tax research. Tax practice and procedure, and partnership taxation.
ACC830.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC833.name: Federal Income Taxation of Corporations and Shareholders
ACC833.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
ACC833.description: The Federal income taxation of corporations and shareholders resulting from operations, distributions, formations, liquidation, and reorganizations. Taxation of pass through entities.
ACC833.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC834.name: Taxation of Gifts, Trusts and Estates
ACC834.description: Transfer taxes applied to gifts and transfers at death. Transfer tax planning including the use of trusts.
ACC834.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC836.name: U. S. Taxation of Multinational Transactions
ACC836.description: Federal income taxation of transactions by U.S. persons outside the United States, and of investments by foreign persons in the U.S.
ACC836.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC841.name: Strategic Management Controls Systems
ACC841.description: Management accounting concepts for strategic management and business unit-management. Performance measurement, planning and budgeting, and control system design.
ACC841.prerequisite: (MBA 812 or ACC 341) and (MGT 409 or (MBA 850 or concurrently))
ACC841.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting Major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC843.name: Value Chain Accounting and Analytics
ACC843.description: Design and use of managerial accounting systems to support operational decisions in complex, real-world settings, using analytical techniques and real data.
ACC843.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting Major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC844.name: Management Accounting in Global Enterprises
ACC844.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC844.description: Accounting concepts and methods for use in global enterprises.
ACC844.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting major and open to MBA students or approval of department.

ACC850.name: Accounting for Multiunit Enterprises
ACC850.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC850.description: Financial reporting and tax issues related to business combinations and divestitures and the resulting consolidated reporting of the multi-unit enterprise's financial and tax information.
ACC850.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Accounting major or approval of department.

ACC890.name: Independent Study
ACC890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC890.description: Faculty-supervised study in special topics in accounting.
ACC890.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Professional Accounting major or approval of department.

ACC891.name: Special Topics in Accounting and Information Systems
ACC891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC891.description: Current and emerging issues in accounting and information systems.
ACC891.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Accounting Major.

ACC914.name: Research Topics in Accounting
ACC914.description: Directed readings and written critiques of readings. Student research papers. Participation in the department workshop series, including presentations of research papers and critiques of presented papers.
ACC914.restrictions: Open only to Ph.D. students in the College of Business.

ACC950.name: Doctoral Seminar in Accounting Research
ACC950.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ACC950.description: Research on auditing, financial and managerial accounting, and taxation using theoretical perspectives and research methods from the social sciences and business disciplines.
ACC950.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

ACC999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
ACC999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ACC999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Accounting Major.
